Name: Common Cloud Controls Catalog (CCC)
Description: Common Cloud Controls Catalog (CCC) for AWS

Requirements.Description: When the signature validation process is performed, then it MUST detect any modification of data.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN01 Implement Digital Signatures With Hash Chaining
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Digital signatures allows for external verification of log data tampering and hash chaining allows for deleted log files to be detected.
Attributes.Recommendation: Ensure hash of data is included in digital signature.

Requirements.Description: When the signature validation process is performed, then it MUST detect any missing (deleted) log file.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN01 Implement Digital Signatures With Hash Chaining
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Digital signatures allows for external verification of log data tampering and hash chaining allows for deleted log files to be detected.
Attributes.Recommendation: Ensure verification process includes a chained hash function.

Requirements.Description: When a manual action is performed to generate each audit log type, then the corresponding audit log type MUST be generated and recorded.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN02 Enable And Validate All Audit Log Types
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Review audit log configuration and ensure that all audit log types are being generated and replicated to configured sinks
Attributes.Recommendation: Review audit log configuration

Requirements.Description: When an attempt is made to disable a log source, then an alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN03 Alert On Audit Log Changes And Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that specific alerts have been configured to detect changes in audit log configuration such as disabling exporting of logs. Alerts MUST also be created to detect changes in retention/object lock policies for exported data log sources/buckets.
Attributes.Recommendation: Ensure alerting is correctly configured

Requirements.Description: When an attempt is made to alter the retention or object lock status of an external data log source or bucket, then an alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN03 Alert On Audit Log Changes And Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that specific alerts have been configured to detect changes in audit log configuration such as disabling exporting of logs. Alerts MUST also be created to detect changes in retention/object lock policies for exported data log sources/buckets.
Attributes.Recommendation: Ensure alerting is correctly configured

Requirements.Description: When audit log buckets are created then verify that server access logging MUST be enabled for the audit log bucket, with logs delivered to a separate, secure logging bucket.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the integrity of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN04 Ensure Access Logging Is Enabled on the Audit Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that access logging is enabled for the audit log storage bucket to capture all requests made to the bucket, providing an audit trail of data access.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure the audit log bucket to enable server access logging. Ensure the target logging bucket is configured for appropriate security, including restricted access and immutability.

Requirements.Description: When audit logs are exported, then audit logs MUST be present in the configured data location.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN05 Export Audit Logs To Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Configure audit logs to be sent to a external bucket where they can be globally replicated and can be subject to greater access control and data retention polices.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure audit log exporting.

Requirements.Description: When the retention policy is applied, then data MUST be automatically deleted after the configured number of days.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN06 Enforce Retention Policy on Audit Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Configure a custom retention policy on the designated audit log bucket to ensure that logs are retained for the correct number of days as defined by your organization's policy.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure the audit log bucket's lifecycle rules or object retention settings to enforce the required data retention period.

Requirements.Description: When a standard file deletion is attempted on an object within the audit log bucket, then it MUST be prevented unless MFA is provided.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN07 Enforce MFA Delete on Audit Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) delete on the audit log bucket to provide greater protection against accidental or malicious deletion of audit data.
Attributes.Recommendation: Enable MFA Delete (or equivalent multi-factor authentication for delete operations) on the audit log bucket.

Requirements.Description: When an attempt is made to delete data before the object lock period expires, then the deletion MUST be denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the availability of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN08 Enable Object Lock On Audit Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that object log is enabled globally on all objects with the bucket. The lock time MUST be configured to meet your organization, legal and compliance goals. Deletion attempts before the lock period MUST be denied.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure object lock policy.

Requirements.Description: When restricted fields are accessed by unauthorized users, then those fields MUST remain masked.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the confidentiality of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN09 Restrict Field And Log Type Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Configure access to audit logs to follow the principle of least privilege in particular where technically possible limit the log fields users have access to to prevent accidental exposure to sensitive information such as PII.
Attributes.Recommendation: Review field level access controls on audit data.

Requirements.Description: When audit log storage bucket's are created then, bucket's access control settings MUST explicitly deny public read and write access.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the confidentiality of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN10 Ensure Audit Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that audit log storage buckets are not publicly accessible to prevent unauthorized exposure of sensitive log data.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access. Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

Requirements.Description: When the URL of a audit log storage bucket's object is accessed publicly then, it should be denied by bucket policy.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to protected the confidentiality of Audit Log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.AuditLog.CN10 Ensure Audit Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that audit log storage buckets are not publicly accessible to prevent unauthorized exposure of sensitive log data.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access. Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

Requirements.Description: Attempt to initiate a build using an unauthorized build agent and verify that the build is rejected.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.Build.CN01 Restrict Allowed Build Agents
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that builds are executed only on authorized build agents to maintain control over the build environment and prevent unauthorized code execution.

Requirements.Description: Attempt to trigger a build from an unauthorized external service or repository and verify that the build does not start.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.Build.CN02 Restrict Allowed External Services for Build Triggers
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that builds can only be triggered by authorized external services or repositories to prevent unauthorized code execution or tampering.

Requirements.Description: Attempt to access the build environment from an external network and verify that access is denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.Build.CN03 Deny External Network Access for Build Environments
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that build environments do not have external network access to prevent unauthorized external access and data exfiltration.

Requirements.Description: Attempt to push an artifact with known vulnerabilities to the registry and observe if it is flagged or rejected by the vulnerability scanning process.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CntrReg.CN01 Implement Vulnerability Scanning for Artifacts
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that container images and artifacts stored in the container registry are scanned for vulnerabilities to identify and remediate security issues before deployment.

Requirements.Description: Attempt to access underlying database tables directly without using managed views and verify that access is denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.DataWar.CN01 Enforce Use of Managed Views for Data Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that data access is provided through managed views, restricting users from accessing underlying tables directly and enforcing consistent security policies.

Requirements.Description: Attempt to query sensitive columns without the necessary permissions and verify that access is denied or data is masked.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.DataWar.CN02 Enforce Column-Level Security Policies
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that access to sensitive data columns is restricted based on user roles, preventing unauthorized access to sensitive information.

Requirements.Description: Attempt to query data rows that the user should not have access to and verify that access is denied or data is not returned.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.DataWar.CN03 Enforce Row-Level Security Policies
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that access to data rows is restricted based on user roles or attributes, preventing unauthorized access to specific subsets of data.

Requirements.Description: When a key version is scheduled for deletion or disabled, an alert MUST be generated within five minutes.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that collect, alert, and retain key-management events.
Attributes.Section: CCC.KeyMgmt.CN01 Alert on Key-version Changes
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Generate near-real-time alerts when a KMS key version is disabled or scheduled for deletion, enabling rapid investigation and recovery.
Attributes.Recommendation: Use native event services (e.g., CloudWatch Events, Azure Monitor, Cloud Audit Logs) to route notifications to an incident-response channel.

Requirements.Description: When IAM roles and key policies are reviewed, Decrypt permission MUST be granted exclusively to documented authorised principals.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that enforce least-privilege use of KMS operations.
Attributes.Section: CCC.KeyMgmt.CN02 Limit Decrypt Permissions
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Restrict the Decrypt operation to authorised principals only, applying the principle of least privilege to protect sensitive data.
Attributes.Recommendation: Periodically audit policy documents via automated tooling and report any deviations.

Requirements.Description: When rotation settings are examined, rotation MUST be enabled with an interval not exceeding 365 days.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that govern creation, rotation, import, and retirement of cryptographic keys.
Attributes.Section: CCC.KeyMgmt.CN03 Enforce Automatic Rotation
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure symmetric keys rotate automatically within policy intervals to reduce exposure of key material.
Attributes.Recommendation: Use cloud-provider rotation features and verify via configuration scanning.

Requirements.Description: When a key import request is processed, the key MUST use an approved algorithm (RSA-2048+, EC-P256+) and originate from a certified HSM.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that govern creation, rotation, import, and retirement of cryptographic keys.
Attributes.Section: CCC.KeyMgmt.CN04 Validate Imported Keys
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Accept only externally generated keys that meet approved cryptographic strength and provenance requirements.
Attributes.Recommendation: Implement an approval workflow that validates attestation data before import.

Requirements.Description: When a single client sends more than 2000 requests within any 5-minute sliding window, the load balancer MUST throttle all subsequent requests from that client for at least 60 seconds.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that detect anomalous traffic and record load-balancer activity.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN01 Enforce and Detect Rate Limiting
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Detect and throttle malicious or excessive requests to prevent downstream resource exhaustion and brute-force activity.
Attributes.Recommendation: Implement per-IP token-bucket limits with and verify via synthetic traffic tests.

Requirements.Description: When throttling is invoked, the load balancer MUST record the event in the access log within 5 minutes for alerting and trend analysis.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that detect anomalous traffic and record load-balancer activity.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN01 Enforce and Detect Rate Limiting
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Detect and throttle malicious or excessive requests to prevent downstream resource exhaustion and brute-force activity.
Attributes.Recommendation: Enable access logging and configure metric filters on HTTP 429 counts to trigger alerts.

Requirements.Description: When more than 10 percent of targets change from healthy to unhealthy within five minutes, an alert MUST be issued.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that detect anomalous traffic and record load-balancer activity.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN06 Secure Health-Check Telemetry
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Monitor health-check endpoints for tampering and alert on abnormal status changes.
Attributes.Recommendation: Instrument metrics for health check results and target removal events. Configure monitoring alarms to alert on abnormal spikes in unhealthy targets.

Requirements.Description: When routing weights change, the request MUST originate from an explicitly defined and trusted identity and MUST be logged.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can change or query load-balancer resources.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN04 Enforce Distribution Policies
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure traffic-splitting weights and algorithms are modified only by trusted identities.
Attributes.Recommendation: Define a list of trusted principals allowed to modify routing configurations. Enforce via conditional access policies, and log changes using audit logging.

Requirements.Description: When stickiness is enabled, session cookies MUST expire within 30 minutes of inactivity.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can change or query load-balancer resources.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN05 Validate Session Affinity
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Configure session persistence to minimise fixation and hijacking risks.
Attributes.Recommendation: Audit CCC.LB.F15 parameters via configuration scans.

Requirements.Description: When an API call originates outside the approved CIDR set, the request MUST be denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can change or query load-balancer resources.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN09 Restrict Management API Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Limit load-balancer API calls to authorised identities and trusted networks.
Attributes.Recommendation: Combine VPC endpoints with IAM condition-key filters for protected APIs.

Requirements.Description: When concurrent connections reach 80 percent of capacity, the autoscaling group MUST add at least one instance within five minutes.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that preserve availability and confidentiality of traffic processed by the load balancer.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN02 Auto-Scale Load Balancer Capacity
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Expand load-balancer capacity to maintain availability during traffic spikes.
Attributes.Recommendation: Enable autoscaling policies.

Requirements.Description: When responses pass through the load balancer, the "Server" header MUST be replaced with "lb".

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that preserve availability and confidentiality of traffic processed by the load balancer.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN07 Scrub Sensitive Headers
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Remove headers that disclose internal details or software versions from HTTP responses.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure header-transformation rules.

Requirements.Description: When a certificate is within 30 days of expiry, automated renewal MUST complete and deploy a new certificate within 24 hours.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that ensure trustworthy TLS certificates and ciphers.
Attributes.Section: CCC.LB.CN08 Automate Certificate Renewal
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Maintain valid TLS certificates by automating renewal and deployment before expiry.
Attributes.Recommendation: Use certificate-manager auto-renewal workflows.

Requirements.Description: When a new cloud account is created, provider-level audit and network flow logging MUST be enabled by default and directed to the central sink.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN01 Centralized and Comprehensive Log Aggregation
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure all operational and security logs from across the cloud environment, including applications, operating systems, network traffic, and cloud service activity, are captured automatically and streamed to a central, secure log management service.

Requirements.Description: When a new cloud compute resource is deployed, it MUST be configured to forward all relevant logs (e.g., OS, application, service logs) to the central log sink.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN01 Centralized and Comprehensive Log Aggregation
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure all operational and security logs from across the cloud environment, including applications, operating systems, network traffic, and cloud service activity, are captured automatically and streamed to a central, secure log management service.

Requirements.Description: When a new log bucket or stream is created, its retention policy MUST be configured in accordance with organisation's data retention policy.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN02 Enforce Data Retention Policy for Logs
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that the retention period configured for logs aligns with the organization's data retention policy.

Requirements.Description: When a query is performed to retrieve log events older than the number of days defined in the organisation's data retention policy, it MUST return an empty result.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN02 Enforce Data Retention Policy for Logs
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that the retention period configured for logs aligns with the organization's data retention policy.

Requirements.Description: When an attempt is made to modify or delete data before the object lock period expires, then the action MUST be denied.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls related to the confidentiality, integrity and availability of log data.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN03 Enable Object Lock On Log Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure log immutability by enabling Write Once, Read Many (WORM) protection using object lock on log storage buckets. This prevents logs from being modified or deleted during the defined retention period, supporting compliance and forensic integrity.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure object lock policy.

Requirements.Description: When restricted fields are accessed by unauthorized users, then those fields MUST remain masked.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can access and modify logs.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN04 Restrict Field And Log Type Access
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Configure access to logs to follow the principle of least privilege in particular where technically possible limit the log fields users have access to to prevent accidental exposure to sensitive information such as PII.
Attributes.Recommendation: Review field level access controls on log data.

Requirements.Description: When a log storage bucket is created, the bucket's access control settings MUST explicitly deny public read and write access.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can access and modify logs.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN05 Ensure Log Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that log storage buckets are not publicly accessible to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive log data. In addition, logs should be replicated to another cloud region to enhance availability, durability, and support disaster recovery requirements.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access. Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

Requirements.Description: When the URL of a log storage bucket's object is accessed publicly, the action MUST be denied by bucket policy.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that restrict who can access and modify logs.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN05 Ensure Log Bucket is Not Publicly Accessible
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that log storage buckets are not publicly accessible to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive log data. In addition, logs should be replicated to another cloud region to enhance availability, durability, and support disaster recovery requirements.
Attributes.Recommendation: Configure bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict public access. Regularly review bucket permissions to ensure no public access has been inadvertently granted.

Requirements.Description: When a single principal executes an anomalously high number of log queries, an alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that collect, alert, and retain logging-related events.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN06 Detect and Alert on Potential Log Exfiltration
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Identify and alert on anomalous data access patterns that may indicate an attempt to exfiltrate log data.

Requirements.Description: When an audit log event is recorded that corresponds to a modification of the logging service configuration such as disabling a log trail, deleting a log sink, or altering a log forwarding rule, an alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that collect, alert, and retain logging-related events.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Logging.CN07 Detect and Alert on Log Service Tampering
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Alert when any component of the critical logging infrastructure is disabled, modified, or deleted, indicating a defense evasion attempt.

Requirements.Description: When a request is made to read a protected bucket, the service MUST prevent any request using KMS keys not listed as trusted by the organization.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN01 Prevent Unencrypted Requests
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C01 Prevent Requests to Buckets or Objects with Untrusted KMS Keys
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Prevent any requests to object storage buckets or objects using untrusted KMS keys to protect against unauthorized data encryption that can impact data availability and integrity.

Requirements.Description: When a request is made to read a protected object, the service MUST prevent any request using KMS keys not listed as trusted by the organization.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN01 Prevent Unencrypted Requests
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C01 Prevent Requests to Buckets or Objects with Untrusted KMS Keys
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Prevent any requests to object storage buckets or objects using untrusted KMS keys to protect against unauthorized data encryption that can impact data availability and integrity.

Requirements.Description: When a request is made to write to a bucket, the service MUST prevent any request using KMS keys not listed as trusted by the organization.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN01 Prevent Unencrypted Requests
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C01 Prevent Requests to Buckets or Objects with Untrusted KMS Keys
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Prevent any requests to object storage buckets or objects using untrusted KMS keys to protect against unauthorized data encryption that can impact data availability and integrity.

Requirements.Description: When a request is made to write to an object, the service MUST prevent any request using KMS keys not listed as trusted by the organization.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family

Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C01 Prevent Requests to Buckets or Objects with Untrusted KMS Keys
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Prevent any requests to object storage buckets or objects using untrusted KMS keys to protect against unauthorized data encryption that can impact data availability and integrity.

Requirements.Description: When an object storage bucket deletion is attempted, the bucket MUST be fully recoverable for a set time-frame after deletion is requested.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN03 Implement Multi-factor Authentication (MFA) for Access
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C03 Prevent Bucket Deletion Through Irrevocable Bucket Retention Policy
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that object storage bucket is not deleted after creation, and that the preventative measure cannot be unset.

Requirements.Description: When an attempt is made to modify the retention policy for an object storage bucket, the service MUST prevent the policy from being modified.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN03 Implement Multi-factor Authentication (MFA) for Access
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C03 Prevent Bucket Deletion Through Irrevocable Bucket Retention Policy
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that object storage bucket is not deleted after creation, and that the preventative measure cannot be unset.

Requirements.Description: When an object is uploaded to the object storage system, the object MUST automatically receive a default retention policy that prevents premature deletion or modification.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN04 Log All Access and Changes
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C04 Objects have an Effective Retention Policy by Default
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that all objects stored in the object storage system have a retention policy applied by default, preventing premature deletion or modification of objects and ensuring compliance with data retention regulations.

Requirements.Description: When an attempt is made to delete or modify an object that is subject to an active retention policy, the service MUST prevent the action from being completed.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN04 Log All Access and Changes
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C04 Objects have an Effective Retention Policy by Default
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that all objects stored in the object storage system have a retention policy applied by default, preventing premature deletion or modification of objects and ensuring compliance with data retention regulations.

Requirements.Description: When an object is uploaded to the object storage bucket, the object MUST be stored with a unique identifier.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN05 Prevent Access from Untrusted Entities
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C05 Versioning is Enabled for All Objects in the Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that versioning is enabled for all objects stored in the object storage bucket to enable recovery of previous versions of objects in case of loss or corruption.

Requirements.Description: When an object is modified, the service MUST assign a new unique identifier to the modified object to differentiate it from the previous version.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN05 Prevent Access from Untrusted Entities
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C05 Versioning is Enabled for All Objects in the Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that versioning is enabled for all objects stored in the object storage bucket to enable recovery of previous versions of objects in case of loss or corruption.

Requirements.Description: When an object is modified, the service MUST allow for recovery of previous versions of the object.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN05 Prevent Access from Untrusted Entities
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C05 Versioning is Enabled for All Objects in the Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that versioning is enabled for all objects stored in the object storage bucket to enable recovery of previous versions of objects in case of loss or corruption.

Requirements.Description: When an object is deleted, the service MUST retain other versions of the object to allow for recovery of previous versions.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN05 Prevent Access from Untrusted Entities
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C05 Versioning is Enabled for All Objects in the Bucket
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that versioning is enabled for all objects stored in the object storage bucket to enable recovery of previous versions of objects in case of loss or corruption.

Requirements.Description: When an object storage bucket is accessed, the service MUST store access logs in a separate data store.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN06 Prevent Deployment in Restricted Regions
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C06 Access Logs are Stored in a Separate Data Store
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that access logs for object storage buckets are stored in a separate data store to protect against unauthorized access, tampering, or deletion of logs (Logbuckets are exempt from this requirement, but must be tlp-red).

Requirements.Description: When a permission set is allowed for an object in a bucket, the service MUST allow the same permission set to access all objects in the same bucket.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN02 Ensure Data Encryption at Rest for All Stored Data
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C02 Enforce Uniform Bucket-level Access to Prevent Inconsistent Permissions
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that uniform bucket-level access is enforced across all object storage buckets. This prevents the use of ad-hoc or inconsistent object-level permissions, ensuring centralized, consistent, and secure access management in accordance with the principle of least privilege.

Requirements.Description: When a permission set is denied for an object in a bucket, the service MUST deny the same permission set to access all objects in the same bucket.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.CN02 Ensure Data Encryption at Rest for All Stored Data
Attributes.SubSection: CCC.ObjStor.C02 Enforce Uniform Bucket-level Access to Prevent Inconsistent Permissions
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure that uniform bucket-level access is enforced across all object storage buckets. This prevents the use of ad-hoc or inconsistent object-level permissions, ensuring centralized, consistent, and secure access management in accordance with the principle of least privilege.

Requirements.Description: When an External Monitoring system exceeds the anticipated rate of monitoring checks then Rate Limiting MUST be applied and an Audit Alert MUST be generated.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that collect, alert, and retain events from other monitoring services.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Monitor.CN01 Rate Limiting on External Monitoring
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Prevent DoS attacks using External Monitoring tools.

Requirements.Description: When an Custom or User-Defined Metric starts to flood a collector, then a rate limit MUST be applied to reduce the network impact of traffic and an alert must triggered.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls that collect, alert, and retain events from other monitoring services.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Monitor.CN02 Rate Limiting on Metric Generation
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Prevent Malicious Actor or misconfiguration from flooding services with metric data.

Requirements.Description: When external systems have approved access to internal systems not normally available for public access then they MUST be secured to prevent unauthorised access jumping through to the internal systems and only allow access to specific internal services.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to prevent unauthorised access to monitoring features.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Monitor.CN03 Access External Monitoring
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Control access to Synthetic monitoring solutions using API keys or Certificate based authentication to ensure they don't become an attack path, preventing monitoring systems from forging network requests to gain access to internal systems.

Requirements.Description: When monitoring dashboards display degraded services which may become potential targets then the dashboard MUST be protected from unauthorised access.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to prevent unauthorised access to monitoring features.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Monitor.CN04 Restrict access to Monitoring Dashboards
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Control access to Monitoring Dashboards and reports to ensure they don't highlight an attack path.

Requirements.Description: When monitoring services have generated an alert, the service MUST ensure only authorised responders silence or acknowledge the alert.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to prevent unauthorised access to monitoring features.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Monitor.CN05 Restrict access to silence or acknowledge an alert
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure only a subset of users can silence or acknowledge alerts to prevent attackers hiding their activity.

Requirements.Description: When systems push metrics or traces they MUST be authenticated for that particular type of metric or trace

Attributes.FamilyDescription: Controls designed to prevent unauthorised access to monitoring features.
Attributes.Section: CCC.Monitor.CN06 Metrics pushed for authorised services only
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Use IAM to control which types of metrics or traces can be pushed by different system to avoid a compromised system pushing fabricated metrics about a different service

Requirements.Description: When a subscription is created, the subscription MUST NOT contain default network resources.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.VPC.CN01 Restrict Default Network Creation
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Restrict the automatic creation of default virtual networks and related resources during subscription initialization to avoid insecure default configurations and enforce custom network policies.

Requirements.Description: When a VPC peering connection is requested, the service MUST prevent connections from VPCs that are not explicitly allowed.

Attributes.FamilyDescription: TODO: Describe this control family
Attributes.Section: CCC.VPC.CN03 Restrict VPC Peering to Authorized Accounts
Attributes.SubSectionObjective: Ensure VPC peering connections are only established with explicitly authorized destinations to limit network exposure and enforce boundary controls.

Attributes.Recommendation: No normal business operations should disable logs, as this could indicate an attempt to cover up unauthorized access. Ensure that logging mechanisms are tightly integrated with service operations, so that logging cannot be disabled without stopping the service itself.
